turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Soccer in St. Louis.
turn.1: What happened in 2015 with the University of Missouri soccer team?
turn.2: Now back in Division I, the team named new head coach Mario Sanchez, formerly associate head coach of the Louisville Cardinals, in 2015.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Three of the four highest attended NCAA men's soccer regular-season matches of all time were between St. Louis University and SIU Edwardsville at Busch Stadium in St. Louis (22,512 in 1980, 20,122 in 1973, and 15,000 in 1972).
turn.5: Is there anything else of importance?
turn.6: In addition to SLU and SIUE, there are twelve other traditional colleges/universities in the Greater St. Louis area.
turn.7: Do any of them have a soccer team?
turn.8: All of them compete in men's and women;s soccer in either the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) (Divisions II or III) or the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA).
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: St. Louis hosted a number of strong amateur teams and leagues that were prominent before the modern professional era.
turn.12: Two teams in particular stand out, Simpkins-Ford and St. Louis Kutis.
